metadata.title: CVE-2017-16643 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
The parse_hid_report_descriptor function in drivers/input/tablet/gtco.c inthe Linux kernel before 4.13.11 allows local users to cause a denial ofservice (out-of-bounds read and system crash) or possibly have unspecifiedother impact via a crafted USB device.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-16643` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.13.0-25-generic - 4.13.0-25.29
linux-image-4.13.0-25-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-25.29
linux-image-4.13.0-25-lowlatency - 4.13.0-25.29
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-25-generic - 4.13.0-25.29
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1008-raspi2 - 4.13.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1001-aws - 4.15.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1002-azure - 4.15.0-1002.2
linux-image-extra-4.15.0-1002-azure - 4.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1001-gcp - 4.15.0-1001.1
linux-image-extra-4.15.0-1001-gcp - 4.15.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1002-kvm - 4.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1002-oem - 4.15.0-1002.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-25.29').
linux-raspi2 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1008.8').
linux-aws package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1001.1').
linux-azure package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1002.2').
linux-gcp package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1001.1').
linux-kvm package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1002.2').
linux-oem package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1002.3').
